name: performable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of a play, piece of music, dance, etc.) able to be acted, sung, played, etc. as entertainment: The composer took another four years to flesh out the skeleton into a performable score. The dramatizations are impressive in their originality of approach and theatricality of conception, making them both eminently performable.
(of an action or piece of work) able to be done: The technique is performable if vascular surgeons and interventional radiologists work side by side in the operating theatre. The executive branch has been assigned a function that in the past was performable by the Legislature itself.
